## Working in `geomorph`

.pull-left[

- Hugely influential
  - 2000+ citations
  
- One stop shopping: 
  - digitization/landmarking
  - superimposition (GPA)
  - analysis (PCA, comparative methods)
  - comparative methods for MV data
  - visualization (plotting)

- Landmark analysis based on non-intuitive arrays ("p x k x n")
- Functions not always pipe (`%>%`) friendly
- Graphical outputs use base graphics (ugly)


]

.pull-right[

```{r}
print(plethodon$land[1:3,,1:2])
```
]

## PCA


.pull-left[

- Reduces dimensions of data
  - takes messy, high-dimensional dataset and rotates it until the biggest patterns emerge.
  - 10s, 100s variables into components
  

- Iterative
  - "draws" vectors through original data
  - each successive vector represents an orthagonal component of decreasing variance


]
